reviews.raw_text:
Food was pretty good. The service was the worst. It was really bad!!! My family was stared at the entire time we ate by the staff. We did get there at 9:30pm and they close at 10pm but we asked if  they could still serve a table for 5 people and said no problem. So we ordered and paid right away because we understood the time. But by 9:50pm we were getting rushed out. We did finish most of our food and ready to get out of there by 10. But the entire time we were there was really uncomfortable. If they would have told us only to go orders that would have been fine. But to dine in that was my worst experience at a dine in restaurant. I wouldn‚Äôt ever come back or recommend this place ‚Äúbased on today‚Äôs experience‚Äù there are so many other Thai restaurants to choose from. This one is definitely a Nooo!!!!

Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $20‚Äì30
Food: 3
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 2

reviews.raw_text:
Been coming here and we love it. My daughter LOVES this place. Seems like we found her favorite restaurant üòã
The servers are a hit or miss. We've had some bad servers before, it almost seems as if they don't want to be there. And then there are others who are just delightful!
Tom Yum is delicious! The Crispy Mango Chicken, the Crying Tiger (my dad LOVES it) the Pad See Ew, the Curry Pineapple Fried Rice, all these are so delicious and we always order them.
Definitely a place to try and keep coming to.
*** They do have a surcharge for a party of 6 or more (including babies) üòí that I am NOT ok with. Why would you charge for kids under 4? They really don't bother the servers like we do. For that reason, 4 stars üåü instead of 5

reviews.raw_text:
I‚Äôve been meaning to try Thai by Trio for months and finally made it in tonight. The space was bright and welcoming, still lively even close to closing. Our food came out lightning fast. Both the crab fried rice and duck curry really hit the spot. The rice was comforting, though fresh crab would‚Äôve taken it up a notch. The duck curry was rich, and flavorful. I was reminded of the first time I had this dish, so delicious! They‚Äôve also got beer and soju cocktails if you‚Äôre in the mood. Glad I finally gave this place a chance. Looks like I‚Äôve found my new go-to in the neighborhood.

Price per person: $20‚Äì30
Food: 4
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5
Noise level: Moderate noise
Seating type: Indoor dining area, Bar area

reviews.raw_text:
Ordered a vegan tom kha soup for pick up on the phone, he said they would make it with vegetable broth, we got home and found that it was made with fish broth.

We called back, and they confirmed that a mistake was made, but refused to give a refund unless we drove all the way back to the restaurant.

Vegetarians and vegans beware of ordering for pick up!

Service: Take out
Meal type: Dinner

reviews.raw_text:
Ordered take out, Beef Bangkok Eggplant with extra beef and shrimp. Smelled fantastic on the ride home and was pretty excited to dig in. So terribly disappointed by the flavorless dish. The beef was either sitting out all day and/or the toughest part of the cow because I was never able to chew the beef to eat it. It was flavorless, dry and rubbery. Completely inedible. The 3 shrimp in the dish was also flavorless, but thankfully not overcooked. Terrible packaging for take out. Leaked out of the loose fitting lid. Like I said I ordered takeout but while waiting to pick up the food I got to see what the restaurant looked like. Atmosphere was nice but was totally empty and that should have been my main queue to not order here. Service personnel was not nice but not rude either. Just didn't get any warm and fuzzies from them. I won't be back.

Service: Take out
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $20‚Äì30
Food: 1
Service: 3
Atmosphere: 4
Wait time: No wait
Parking space: Somewhat difficult to find parking

Parking: 1 meter in front

reviews.raw_text:
Thai by Trio ‚Äì A Go-To Thai Spot Near USC

Thai by Trio is hands-down one of the best Thai restaurants in the USC campus area. Located conveniently near University Park, it draws a steady flow of students and locals alike‚Äîfor both dine-in meals and quick to-go orders.

The interior features a clean, modern design that balances comfort and style. Whether you're grabbing a casual lunch or dining in with friends, the space feels inviting.

The food is consistently flavorful and generous in portion size. Some favorites from my visits:

Chicken Satay (4 pcs): Perfectly grilled and served with rich peanut sauce, this makes for an ideal starter.

Spicy Rib-Eye Salad: A standout dish with tender steak slices that are full of flavor and paired with fresh greens and a spicy kick.

Mango Salmon Salad: A refreshing and well-balanced dish‚Äîgrilled salmon filets with mango slices and crisp veggies make it both light and satisfying.

Thai Milk Tea w/ Boba is very popular among the desks while I think it might be too sweet.

For mains:

Pineapple Fried Rice and Phad Thai are excellent choices. Both are served in generous portions, often enough for two people. The Phad Thai features a sweet-savory balance with a crunch of peanuts and customizable protein options.

Green Curry is aromatic and creamy, while the Red and Yellow curries pack more heat‚Äîtoo spicy for my taste, but perfect for chili lovers. Rice would be offered with the curry.

Tom Yum Soup is an option too, though I found it a bit too heavy on spices, leaning toward an overpowering profile.

Service here is consistently warm and efficient. The staff are friendly and the food is prepared quickly, making it a great option even on a tight schedule.

Parking is available in the covered lot behind the apartment complex, which adds to the convenience‚Äîsomething rare around campus.

---

In summary, Thai by Trio offers a great balance of taste, price, and speed‚Äîa dependable choice near USC for satisfying Thai cuisine.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $20‚Äì30
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5
Recommended dishes: Bulgogi, Crab Fried Rice, Chicken Satay, Thai Boat Noodle Soup, Chicken Pad Thai, Pineapple Fried Rice, Tom Yum Soup
Wait time: Up to 10 min
Recommendation for vegetarians: Somewhat recommend
Vegetarian offerings: Vegetarian menu or section
Parking space: Somewhat difficult to find parking
Parking options: Free parking garage

reviews.raw_text:
This restaurant scammed me out of $94.45. First, they charged my card with an incorrect amount. About five minutes later, the manager came over and told me the amount was wrong and that the transaction had been canceled. She even showed me a cancellation receipt. Unfortunately, I had no way to verify the authenticity of that receipt. I then paid the so-called corrected second bill of $56.

Sadly, I never got my $94.45 back ‚Äî despite filing a complaint. What a shame. Such fraudsters!

reviews.raw_text:
hidden gem for anyone craving authentic Thai cuisine I ordered the pad thai and the green curry, and both dishes were incredible! The pad thai was perfectly balanced with just the right amount of sweetness and spice, while the green curry was rich and flavorful, packed with fresh vegetables and tender protein.

The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it a great spot for a casual meal. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed throughout our visit.

If you're in Los Angeles and looking for delicious Thai food, Thai By Trio is a must-try! I can‚Äôt wait to come back and explore more of their menu!

If you're in Los Angeles and looking for delicious Thai food, Thai By Trio is a must-try! I can‚Äôt wait to come back and explore more of their menu!

We enjoyed a classy Thai food here for dinner.
The Tom-kha soup was brought with a burner and served hit for the cold evening. The fried shrimp was delicious. The fried rice was ok but the ped-sew was outstanding. The food was served quickly , steaming hot and with perfect flavors. I also noticed that this is irrespective of the crowd size. FASTER SERIVICE..
It bursted all The flavors and was so satisfying.
Highly recommend this place for a nice

reviews.raw_text:
I don't usually write reviews, but this place was so good I'm leaving it.
I ate DIM SUM,VIETNAMESE HAND ROLL,
TOM YUM NOODLE SOUP,PAD THAI.
Everything was delicious.
The texture and flavor of the dim sum was especially great. The Tom Yum Noodle was also great with its spiciness and flavor. The pad thai, ingredients and noodles were great.
I am Asian, so I eat Thai food a lot,this is the best Thai food in Los Angeles.
Service was very good and I would go back again.
Parking was located behind the restaurant and was free.

Their Pad Se Ew and Spicy Fried Rice were amazinggg and would come back again to have that however... Holy crap their red curry was watery and super bland... I know Thai curries tend to be less thick but wow I was quite disappointed.. it came out in like 2 minutes which was also suspicious. Had to add salt to the curry and didn't help much

reviews.raw_text:
Food is Mediocre. I expected better due to rating but honestly nahh!! Food is ok but not worth the high prices. I would expect better quality at there high prices. Also I feel all the food is premade. We literally finished ordering and the food took 5 min to be served. Not the greatest feeling as you paying fresh to order not fast food. So very questionable. I had the Pad Thai $18 noodles and they were to wet and soggy also hardly any noodles served. Chicken curry $18 I‚Äôm not kidding when I say you can count the 6 slices of thin small pieces of chicken. Tom Kah Soup $24 for the pot which also was small. I will say it was good I enjoyed it also they do have a nice ambiance and the place is clean. I spent about $85 total 2 people. Thai is one of my favorite foods and I look forward to ordering different dishes and sharing amongst my family and always having leftovers to take home. However not the case here and well not that great either. I would not come back. So many better Thai restaurants that serve better food and give you good portions to share and enjoy with the rest of the table. Sorry but just not with it for me! The 3 stars was because the place is nice and clean.

Food: 3
Service: 3
Atmosphere: 3

Food: 4
Service: 4

My parents were looking for a Thai spot nearby via Uber eats & this popped up.

I ordered hainam chicken, a vegetable stir fry and a tiramisu. The hainam chicken was delicious, I usually prefer crispy version but this version was very tender and the rice was cooked perfectly with a garlicky flavor.  The stir fray was also good but the tiramisu was the best of the bunch.  The milk tea boba was about average but still pretty descent. Overall a solid dinner delivery.

I‚Äôd definitely order from this order again. I‚Äôd like to try this spot and dine in, in the future.

Service: Delivery
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $50‚Äì100
